intro: Staurogyne parva, commonly known as the small starwort, is a small aquatic or semi-aquatic plant native to the Americas. It typically grows in freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are usually less than 1 centimeter in length. It produces tiny, clustered flowers that are often greenish or yellowish in color. Staurogyne parva plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small fish.
